issue_description:
# Remove beta register and blocker templates

### Idea summary

There are still two remaining templates related to the beta registration/blocker. Delete those templates.

### Further details

Remove the following templates:

- [ ] `threads/templates/threads/beta_blocker.html`
- [ ] `threads/templates/threads/beta_register.html`

issue_comments.body: I am unable to find those templates I guess those are deleted already

Ah, strange. I must have been on a stale branch. Thanks for taking a look @ssm0801! I'll add you for review anyhow

@all-contributors please add @ssm0801 for review

@brylie 

I could not determine your intention.

Basic usage: @all-contributors please add @someone for code, doc and infra

For other usages see the [documentation](https://allcontributors.org/docs/en/bot/usage)

@brylie 

I've put up [a pull request](https://github.com/CiviWiki/OpenCiviWiki/pull/1063) to add @ssm0801! :tada:
Can you tell me what does it mean, add @ssm0801 for review ?

It means that you contributed to this project by reviewing code quality since you found that no changes were necessary. We want to acknowledge many types of contributions, so we are following the [All Contributors project](https://allcontributors.org/) guidelines.

questions_generated: What is the main task described in the issue regarding the CiviWiki_OpenCiviWiki repository?
Why might the contributor have been unable to find the templates mentioned in the issue?
What does the command '@all-contributors please add @ssm0801 for review' signify in the context of this repository?

golden_answers_generated: The main task is to remove two remaining templates related to beta registration/blocker, specifically `threads/templates/threads/beta_blocker.html` and `threads/templates/threads/beta_register.html`.
The contributor was unable to find the templates because they might have already been deleted or the contributor was on a stale branch that did not reflect the most recent changes.

This command is used to acknowledge @ssm0801's contribution to the project by reviewing the code. It is part of the All Contributors project guidelines, which aim to recognize various types of contributions in open-source projects.
The beta registration/blocker templates might be removed because they are no longer needed, possibly due to the application moving out of beta stage or the feature being deprecated.

Acknowledging code review contributions helps maintainers recognize all forms of valuable contributions, not just code additions. It encourages community participation, motivates contributors, and helps maintain a healthy and collaborative open-source ecosystem.
